Mithril dragons are metal dragons found in the Ancient Cavern and the extended area of the Brimhaven Dungeon resource dungeon. To access the Ancient Cavern, the player needs to have started the Pyre ship section of Firemaking in Barbarian Training. To access the extended area of the Brimhaven Dungeon resource dungeon, the player must wear the Daemonheim aura 4 from the elite set of the Daemonheim achievements. These dragons have extremely high defence but, since they are made of metal, are relatively weak to magic, with earth spells being their primary weakness. Mithril dragons are often killed for their possible drops, which include the dragon full helms, draconic visages, chewed bones, and elite clue scrolls.

Mithril dragons are an excellent source of charms, as they drop four of them at a time. They are also a good source of rune salvage.

When they originally were released, they broke the King Black Dragon's record as the strongest dragon, though this has since changed.

Killing a Mithril dragon for the first time completes the How to Maim Your Dragon achievement.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 64,914 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Mithril dragon kill is worth 10,618 coins.

Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but they will increase the chance of accessing the rare drop table and may also improve the loot received from it.

These items are dropped alongside main drops.

    • Achievements[edit | edit source]

    • La Petite Mort ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Kandarin.
      • Dragon full helm and chewed bones drops
    • How to Maim Your Dragon ( 15) – Kill a mithril dragon.

    Graphical updates[edit | edit source]

    • Mithril dragon after 3 July 2007 (update)

    • Mithril dragon after Unknown date (edit)

    Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • patch 16 November 2020 (Update):
      • The colours of bronze, iron, steel and mithril dragons will now display correctly.
    • ninja 25 April 2016 (Update):
      • Improved respawn rates for Mithril Dragons.
    • patch 20 October 2009 (Update):
      • When fighting mithril dragons, other dragons shouldn't be able to barge in and steal focus.
    • patch 9 September 2009 (Update):
      • Improved various dragons’ fire-breath code behaviour to match the KBD's existing behaviour. The actual animation has not changed.
    • update 3 July 2007 (Update):
      • Added to game.

    Trivia[edit | edit source]

    • During the fusing of the dragonkin key, the mithril dragon temporarily appears as level 150.
    • In a Postbag from the hedge, Oziach pointed out that there are bronze dragons, iron dragons, steel dragons, and mithril dragons when he was chatting with Evil Dave. Oziach deduced that there will be adamant dragons, rune dragons, and even dragon dragons.
    • When killed, it says on the Adventurer's Log: "I killed [number] of mithril dragons." If the player killed 1, it would be "I killed a mithril dragon."
    • Their examine text indicates that metallic dragons, or at least mithril ones, may be the result of unnatural experimentation; of course, this may also refer to how they were created by the dragonkin. With the release of the quest One of a Kind, this has been confirmed.
    • Mithril dragons are the only metallic dragons that do not drop the dragon platelegs and plateskirt.

    References[edit | edit source]

    1. ^ Mod Timbo. Always dreamed of getting this drop...first task on this account...what are the odds. Reddit. 5 December 2017. (Archived from the original on 14 October 2020.) Mod Timbo: "1/32,768 (or 1/31,744 if you were wearing Ring of Fortune or better)"
    2. ^ Mod Timbo. "Dev Blog: Revealing Drop Rates." 17 November 2017. (Archived from the original on 18 November 2017.) Existing Game Content Forums.
